chapter.title: Installing Using the Installation Workflow
chapter.para: This is a guided installation of the operating system with optimized settings for SAP applications. During the installation workflow, you can choose whether you want to install an SAP application. If so, you will be asked to provide SAP installation media when the &sls; installation is finished.

sect1.title: Installing the Operating System
sect1.para: This section will guide you through the installation of the &sles4sap; operating system.

step.para: Boot from the DVD. From the DVD boot menu, select Installation.
While the initial operating system is starting, you can view boot messages by pressing . When this process has completed, the graphical installation workflow will start.
Select the default system language under Language.
Select a fitting keyboard layout Keyboard Layout. To test whether the selected layout matches your physical keyboard, use the text box Keyboard Test.
Read the license agreement. If you agree, select I Agree to the License Terms. Proceed with Next.
Otherwise, cancel the installation with Abort Abort Installation.
If automatic network configuration via DHCP fails, the screen Network Settings will automatically open.
If you find yourself already on the screen Registration, your network connection works. To change network settings anyway, click Network Configuration.
When you are finished configuring networking, proceed with Next.

important.title: Configure Networking as Recommended by SAP
important.para: Make sure to configure the network connection as recommended by the documentation of your SAP application.

step.para:
For details regarding network configuration, see
&admin;, Chapter 19 Basic Networking, Section 19.4 Configuring a Network Connection with YaST (&docaddress;).
On the screen Registration, enter your E-Mail Address and Registration Code. Successful registration is a prerequisite for receiving product updates and being entitled to technical support.
Proceed with Next.

important.title: Register at This Step
important.para: Make sure to register your system at this step in the installation. Otherwise, you will not receive package updates immediately and your finished installation will lack vital packages from the &sle; &hasi; repository.

note.title: Release Notes
note.para: From this point on, the Release Notes can be viewed from any screen during the installation process by selecting Release Notes.

step.para: When asked whether to enable update repositories, choose Yes.

On the screen, Extension and Module Selection, you can optionally choose additional &slea; extensions and modules. The list contains free modules, such as the &sle; SDK and extensions requiring a registration key that is liable for costs. Proceed with Next.
The following screen allows you to choose the Product Installation Mode. You can now choose between:

formalpara.title: A &sls; installation
formalpara.para:
To install a &slsa; system without SAP-specific customizations, choose Proceed with standard SLES installation. For details, see
&instquick;, Section 1.2 Installing &sls; (&docaddress;).

listitem.remark: Actually, it seems that the only difference between the SLES and the SLES for SAP installation in terms of necessary steps is that the SLES for SAP does not allow you to define a user password. So, is the Installation Quick Start really necessary? - sknorr, 2016-01-12

formalpara.title: A &sles4sap; installation
formalpara.para: To install a &slsa; system with SAP-specific customizations, choose Proceed with standard SLES for SAP Applications installation.

listitem.para: To install an SAP Application together with the system, check Start the SAP Installation Wizard right after the OS installation.
To prepare the system for later installation of a SAP Application, leave Start the SAP Installation Wizard right after the OS installation unchecked.

step.para: Proceed with Next.
You can now choose whether to install an Add On Product. Proceed with Next.
Review the proposed partition setup for the volumes root and swap. The volume data will be created later, as described in .

The old guide was a bit more detailed about the situation with multiple hard disks. Basically, "you need to use Create Partition Setup" but in more elaborate prose. Fixme? - sknorr, 2016-01-13 Suitable values are preselected. However, if necessary, change the partition layout. You have the following options:

listitem.para: Allows you to change the options for the proposed settings, but not the suggested partition layout itself.
Select a disk to which to apply the proposal.
Open the Expert Partitioner described in Deployment Guide, Chapter 14 Advanced Disk Setup, Section 14.1 Using the YaST Partitioner (&docaddress;).
For partitioning advice specific to &sles4sap;, see .

step.para: To accept the proposed setup without changes, proceed with Next.
step.remark: Figure is maybe not ideal - it shows a hard drive with only 100GB of space... Fixme? - sknorr, 2016-01-20

step.para: Select the clock and time zone to use in your system. To manually adjust the time or to configure an NTP server for time synchronization, choose Other Settings. For detailed information, see Deployment Guide, Chapter 6 Installation with YaST, Section 6.10 Clock and Time Zone (&docaddress;).
Proceed with Next.

Type a password for the system administrator account (called root) and repeat the password under Confirm Password. You can use the input box Test Keyboard Layout to make sure that all special characters appear correctly.
For more information, see Deployment Guide, Chapter 6 Installation with YaST, Section 6.12 Password for the System Administrator root (&docaddress;).
Proceed with Next.

important.title: Do Not Forget the root Password
important.para: The user root has the permission to carry out all administrative tasks. Without this password, you will not be able to log in to the system as root.
After you have entered the root password here, it cannot be retrieved again.

step.para: On the screen Installation Settings, you can review and, if necessary, change several proposed installation settings. Each setting is shown alongside its current configuration. To change parts of the configuration, click the headline or other underlined items.
step.remark: Ask varkoly for Firewall settings: do you really need to open ports when enabling firewall here? How about when you enable Fw later? - sknorr, 2016-01-20
Is there a need to copy the descriptions of all the categories from the Installation Quick Start here too? Or just a reference there? - sknorr, 2016-01-12

tip.title: Pattern High Availability Is Unnecessary
tip.para: To save hard drive space, you can remove the pattern High Availability from the installation. Note that this pattern is distinct from the product &sle; &hasi; which you should not try to remove.
To remove the pattern, click Software and then deselect Primary Functions High Availability. Return to the overview with OK.

step.para: When you are satisfied with the system configuration, click Install.
Depending on your software selection, you may need to agree to further license agreements before you are asked to confirm that you want to start the installation process.

warning.title: Deletion of Data
warning.para: Starting the installation process means that information on the disk you are installing on will fully or partly be deleted.
warning.remark: Is this really necessary? It is not in the original installation QS... - sknorr, 2016-01-13

step.para: In the installation confirmation box, click Install.
When the installation if the operating system is finished, the system will reboot automatically.

listitem.para: If you chose to only prepare the system for installation, the system will boot to a desktop login screen.
If you chose to install an SAP application immediately after the operating system, the installation will continue after the the reboot.
